attrs.label: Enable WebUI
attrs.description:
Enable WebUI for Collabora
If you enable this, you will need to set a username and password</br>

schema.valid_chars_error:
Password must be at least 8 characters long and contain at least one of the following:</br>
- Uppercase letter</br>
- Lowercase letter</br>
- Number</br>
- Special character</br>

attrs.label: Server Name
attrs.description: The server name for Collabora.

attrs.label: Alias Group 1
attrs.description:
List of domains that will be allowed to access the Collabora server
Type one domain per line

attrs.description: Dictionaries to be used by Collabora.

attrs.label: Extra Parameters
attrs.description: Extra parameters to be passed to Collabora.

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables  forCollabora.

attrs.label: Web Port
attrs.description: The port for the Collabora Web UI.

attrs.label: Certificate
attrs.description: The certificate for Collabora.

attrs.label: Additional Storage
attrs.description: Additional storage for Collabora.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to a persistent volume claim.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB Share (Mounts a persistent volume claim to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Read Only
attrs.description: Mount the volume as read only.

attrs.label: Mount Path
attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: Host Path to perform ACL

attrs.label: ACL Entries
attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.label: ID
attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: Force Flag
attrs.description: Enabling `Force` applies ACL even if the path has existing data

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: ixVolume Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.label: Path
attrs.description: Path to perform ACL

attrs.label: ACL Entries
attrs.description: ACL Entries

attrs.label: ID
attrs.description: Make sure to check the ID value is correct and aligns with RunAs user context of the application

attrs.label: SMB Share Configuration
attrs.description: The configuration for the SMB Share.

attrs.label: Server
attrs.description: The server for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Share
attrs.description: The share name for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Domain (Optional)
attrs.description: The domain for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Username
attrs.description: The username for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: The password for the SMB share.

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)
attrs.description: The size of the volume quota.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for WG-Easy.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for WG-Easy.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

groups.name: Collabora Environment Variables
groups.description: Set the environment that will be visible to the container

groups.name: Resource Limits
groups.description: Set CPU/memory limits for Kubernetes Pod

attrs.label: Enable WebUI
attrs.description:
Enable WebUI for Collabora
If you enable this, you will need to set a username and password</br>

schema.valid_chars_error:
Password must be at least 8 characters long</br>
Can contain at numbers, letters, and the following characters: !@#%^&*?

attrs.label: Alias Group 1
attrs.description:
List of domains that will be allowed to access the Collabora server
Type one domain per line

attrs.label: Dictionaries to use, leave empty to use all

schema.default: de_DE en_GB en_US es_ES fr_FR it nl pt_BR pt_PT ru

attrs.label: Extra Parameters to add
attrs.description: e.g. "--o:welcome.enable=false", See more on /etc/loolwsd/loowsd.xml. Separate params with space

attrs.label: Server Name
attrs.description:
When this environment variable is set (is not “”), then its value will be used as server name in /etc/loolwsd/loolwsd.xml.
Without this, CODE is not delivering a correct host for the websocket connection in case of a proxy in front of it.</br>
If a port is not specified, the below configured Node Port will be used.

questions.description:
Collabora Certificate</br>
If you do not choose a certificate and do not configure an external reverse proxy</br>
you might have to adjust the extra_params.
questions.label: Certificate

items.label: Collabora Host Path Volume
items.description: Add an extra host path volume for Collabora application

attrs.label: Mount Path in Pod
attrs.description: Path where the volume will be mounted inside the pod

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: Host path

questions.label: Node Port to use for Collabora
CPU Limit
questions.description: CPU resource limit allow  plain integer values with suffix m(milli) e.g 1000m, 100.

questions.label: Memory Limit
questions.description: Memory limits is specified by number of bytes. Followed by quantity suffix like E,P,T,G,M,k and Ei,Pi,Ti,Mi,Gi,Ki can also be used. e.g 129e6, 129M,  128974848000m, 123Mi

1.2.30.app_readme:
Collabora Online Development Edition

An awesome, Online Office suite image suitable for home use. With the Collabora Online Development Edition (CODE) Docker Image you can host your own online Office Suite at home! This Docker image is aimed at home users and contains the latest and greatest developments. Simply integrate it in your preferred File Sync and Share (FSS), to easily get your own online Office Suite up and running!
1.2.30.detailed_readme:
Collabora Online Development Edition

Collabora Online Development Edition - An awesome, Online Office suite image suitable for home use! Introduction

This chart bootstraps Collabora deployment on a Kubernetes cluster using the Helm package manager.
